question:
An 80-ton airplane stands on the tarmac. The airplane is 50 meters long; the main wheels are 27 meters from the nose, and the nose wheel is 3 meters from the nose. How large is the force on the nose wheel?
(We assume the mass of the plane is distributed uniformly.)

answers.feedback:
Correct. Balance forces: $F_\mathrm{z} = F_\mathrm{n, nose} + F_\mathrm{n, wheels}$. 
 Balance torques: $F_\mathrm{z} r_\mathrm{z} = F_\mathrm{nose} r_\mathrm{nose} 
 \Rightarrow 80,000 \cdot g \cdot 2 = F_\mathrm{nose} \cdot 24 
 \Rightarrow F_\mathrm{nose} = 1 569 600 / 24 = 65400\;\mathrm{N}$.
This answer is just dead wrong.
This answer is the force on the main wheels.
